intro: Aloe kaokoensis, commonly known as the Kaoko aloe, is a succulent plant native to Namibia and Angola. It is characterized by its rosette of thick, fleshy leaves that are typically green with a pale blue or white underside. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing yellow flowers, which bloom during the wet season. Aloe kaokoensis is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves to survive prolonged dry periods. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is considered a rare and endangered species.
